metadata.description:
RESONATOR SPECTROSCOPY VERSUS FLUX
This sequence involves measuring the resonator by sending a readout pulse and demodulating the signals to
extract the 'I' and 'Q' quadratures. This is done across various readout frequencies and flux biases.
The resonator frequency as a function of flux bias is then extracted and fitted in order to extract the relevant 
flux biases and corresponding readout frequency.

This information can then be used to adjust the readout frequency for the maximum and minimum frequency points.
The flux point parameter (qubit.z.flux_point) is used in order to decide to update the independent or joint offset.

Prerequisites:
    - Having calibrated the resonator frequency (nodes 02a, 02b and/or 02c).
    - Having specified the desired flux point (qubit.z.flux_point).


State update:
    - The readout frequency for the chosen flux bias: qubit.resonator.f_01 & qubit.resonator.RF_frequency
    - The joint or independent offset depending on the chosen flux point: qubit.z.
    - The min offset: qubit.z.min_offset
    - The relevant flux offset: qubit.z.independent_offset or qubit.z.joint_offset 
    - The min offset: qubit.z.min_offset
    - phi0: qubit.z.phi0_voltage and qubit.z.phi0_current
metadata.name: 02c_resonator_spectroscopy_vs_flux

qubits.description: A list of qubit names which should participate in the execution of the node. Default is None.
qubits.title: Qubits

multiplexed.description:
Whether to play control pulses, readout pulses and active/thermal reset at the same time for all qubits (True)
or to play the experiment sequentially for each qubit (False). Default is False.
multiplexed.title: Multiplexed

use_state_discrimination.description:
Whether to use on-the-fly state discrimination and return the qubit 'state', or simply return the demodulated
quadratures 'I' and 'Q'. Default is False.
use_state_discrimination.title: Use State Discrimination

reset_type.description:
The qubit reset method to use. Must be implemented as a method of Quam.qubit. Can be "thermal", "active", or
"active_gef". Default is "thermal".
reset_type.title: Reset Type

num_shots.description: Number of averages to perform. Default is 100.
num_shots.title: Num Shots

min_flux_offset_in_v.description: Minimum flux bias offset in volts. Default is -0.5 V.
min_flux_offset_in_v.title: Min Flux Offset In V

max_flux_offset_in_v.description: Maximum flux bias offset in volts. Default is 0.5 V.
max_flux_offset_in_v.title: Max Flux Offset In V

num_flux_points.description: Number of flux points. Default is 101.
num_flux_points.title: Num Flux Points

frequency_span_in_mhz.description: Frequency span in MHz. Default is 15 MHz.
frequency_span_in_mhz.title: Frequency Span In Mhz

frequency_step_in_mhz.description: Frequency step in MHz. Default is 0.1 MHz.
frequency_step_in_mhz.title: Frequency Step In Mhz

input_line_impedance_in_ohm.description: Input line impedance in ohms. Default is 50 Ohm.
input_line_impedance_in_ohm.title: Input Line Impedance In Ohm

line_attenuation_in_db.description: Line attenuation in dB. Default is 0 dB.
line_attenuation_in_db.title: Line Attenuation In Db

update_flux_min.description: Flag to update flux minimum frequency point. Default is False.
update_flux_min.title: Update Flux Min

simulate.description: Simulate the waveforms on the OPX instead of executing the program. Default is False.
simulate.title: Simulate

simulation_duration_ns.description: Duration over which the simulation will collect samples (in nanoseconds). Default is 50_000 ns.
simulation_duration_ns.title: Simulation Duration Ns

use_waveform_report.description: Whether to use the interactive waveform report in simulation. Default is True.
use_waveform_report.title: Use Waveform Report

timeout.description: Waiting time for the OPX resources to become available before giving up (in seconds). Default is 120 s.
timeout.title: Timeout

load_data_id.description: Optional QUAlibrate node run index for loading historical data. Default is None.
load_data_id.title: Load Data Id
